node.title: Off-duty cop fatally stabbed on Vegas Strip after argument over dogs
node.description: Edmonds Police Officer Tyler Steffins died of a single stab wound to the chest, the Clark County coroner said.

node.title: U.K. police recommend 20 fines be issued over government "partygate" scandal
node.description: Authorities have been investigating 12 parties and gatherings, some of which Boris Johnson attended, during the height of England's coronavirus lockdown in 2020.

node.title: "Terrible Tilly," Oregon lighthouse on market — for $6.5 million
node.description: The island's isolation, impossible boat landings and extreme weather as well as the lighthouse crews' dislike of their months-long stays earned the tower the nickname "Terrible Tilly." The lighthouse was also once a columbarium.

node.title: Authorities not trying to track down grizzly suspected of killing hiker
node.description: Craig Clouatre was found dead two days after he failed to return from an off-trail hike in densely forested mountains north of Yellowstone.

node.title: Suspect arrested as search for Nevada teen continues
node.description: Investigators haven't said what led them to Troy Driver, 41 but they're still looking for 18-year-old Naomi Irion, who was last seen in a Walmart parking lot more than two weeks ago.

node.title: Southland enters drought restrictions with water in short supply
node.description: Southland is grappling with an extreme dry spell that has prompted water restrictions across the region and a total fire ban.

node.title: Ireland drops America's Cup bid; Barcelona favourite
node.description: Ireland has dropped its bid to host the next America's Cup.

node.title: Suspect in deadly crash into homeless encampment was drunk: authorities
node.description: Prosecutors in Salem, Oregon say Enrique Rodriguez Jr. had roughly twice as much alcohol in his blood as the law allows. The crash killed four and seriously injured two more.

node.title: Goal scorer and top defender recalled to Football Ferns
node.description: Returnees headline Football Ferns squad for trans-Tasman clash.

node.title: Beijing-Honiara pact leaked by 'lunatics and agents of foreign regimes' - Sogavare
node.description: The Solomon Islands prime minister says the leak of a draft security pact was done by "lunatics and agents of foreign regimes" with "no regard for secrecy".

node.title: Labour MP Louisa Wall resigns
node.description: Labour list MP Louisa Wall has resigned this afternoon after 14 years.

node.title: Upcoming benefit increases 'too little, too late' amid high inflation
node.description: Government benefit increases will still leave families trapped in poverty as the cost of living skyrockets, anti-poverty campaigners say.

node.title: NZ must send strong signal to Pacific over China - Defence Minister
node.description: Maintaining a cooperative Defence Force presence in the region - and not solely for humanitarian aid - is a priority for New Zealand, Peeni Henare says.

node.title: Will Smith apologises to Chris Rock for on-stage slap, police won't investigate
node.description: In a social media post, Will Smith has apologised to Chris Rock for slapping the presenter at yesterday's Oscars ceremony, saying he reacted emotionally to a joke at the expense of his wife. Audio

node.title: Central Nelson hopes to reduce emissions with new solar bins
node.description: The bins have a small solar-powered compactor which crushes the rubbish, allowing it to hold more than a standard bin.

node.title: Tourist operator's plea: 'Life has to get back to normal'
node.description: The Omicron outbreak is causing visitor spending to tank in Taranaki after it held its own during earlier stages of the pandemic.

node.title: Unvaccinated surgeons fined $12,000 for seeing patients
node.description: Two eye surgeons have been fined for breaching Covid-19 health orders by seeing patients without being vaccinated.

node.title: Police expand internet intelligence collection team
node.description: Police are moving to bolster its team that scans the internet for threats.

node.title: Police arrest member of far-right movement in Te Puke
node.description: Police have arrested a man involved in New Zealand's far-right movement in Te Puke.

node.title: Recruitment company fined for illegal employment
node.description: An Auckland recruitment company has been fined $3600, and its director $1500, after a Chilean couple seeking work in the horticulture industry were found working illegally at a construction site.

node.title: Border reopening causes 'massive upsurge' in new passport applications
node.description: A lengthy queue for new passports is catching out some New Zealanders trying to make the most of eased border restrictions.

node.title: 'No payment - no gas': Russia holds hard line over European gas payments
node.description: Russia has said it will not supply gas to Europe for free as it works out methods for accepting payments for its gas exports in roubles but G7 nations are refusing the demand.

node.title: 'Bizarre' property strategy leaves ratepayers out of pocket over scout den rental
node.description: Awakeri Scouts will be able to stay in their den for another 10 years, at a cost of $120,000 to the Whakatāne District Council.

node.title: Mongrel Mob member's assets worth $80,000 forfeited to Crown
node.description: Police are welcoming a court order that has stripped assets and cash from a senior Mongrel Mob member.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 34 further deaths, 17,148 new community cases
node.description: Director of Public Health Caroline McElnay says the deaths reported today have occurred over the past 10 days.

node.title: Brian Tamaki wins appeal to allow him to go on holiday after Covid-19 rules change
node.description: Destiny Church pastor Brian Tamaki has been granted a bail variation to go on holiday next month.

node.title: Flood-weary residents in northern NSW ordered to leave homes
node.description: Flood evacuation orders were issued for people on the New South Wales far north coast - the second time in a month for some.

node.title: Senior Tokoroa Hospital clinicians help out as staff shortages bite
node.description: Senior staff at Tokoroa Hospital are plugging the gaps on the wards to replace staff hit by Covid-19.

node.title: Auckland police appeal for sightings of missing 13-year-old girl
node.description: Auckland police are appealing for information in relation to missing 13-year-old Aria Bridger who was last seen in Grafton last Thursday.

node.title: Auckland Transport plan proposes park-and-ride fees, removing kerbside parking
node.description: Auckland Transport is warning people they do not have a right to park on the road outside their house as they seek to change parking rules. Audio
